column1: A culture is a laboratory test that examines the tissue sample for bacteria and other organisms that can cause disease.

These symptoms may include: - Loss of appetite or weight loss - Nausea and vomiting - Pain in the upper part of the belly - Black stools - Vomiting blood or coffee ground-like material A gastric tissue biopsy and culture can help detect: - Cancer - Infections, most commonly Helicobacter pylori, the bacteria that can cause stomach ulcers
A gastric tissue biopsy is normal if it does not show cancer, other damage to the lining of the stomach, or signs of organisms that cause infection.
